headline: Easy Microwave Chocolate Mug Cake
description: Make this chocolate mug cake in the microwave for an individual-sized fudgy chocolate treat in less than 10 minutes! Great for a last-minute dessert.

video.description: A quick and easy dessert that’s perfect for when you don’t have much in the house!
video.name: Microwave Chocolate Mug Cake

name: Easy Microwave Chocolate Mug Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Mix flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large microwave-safe mug; stir in milk, canola oil, water, and vanilla extract.
Cook in the microwave until cake is done in the middle, about 1 minute 45 seconds.

review.reviewBody: Every mug cake I’ve ever tried came out gross and rubbery except this one. The cake is sooo good! I put mini chocolate chips in it and icecream on top when it was done. I’ve made this cake every day for the past week. I’m addicted!!!
This is one of the best chocolate cakes I have ever had! The time was acurate, it was so moist and delicious! If you add mini eggs, lindor and chocolate sauce it takes it up a notch! would reccomend!
I was skeptical because there was no egg, but it was perfect! The cook time was exactly right.

Disgusting hot chocolatey batter, it's far from a cake. In fact the batter tasted better raw. I knew making it that something was wrong as it had no egg. Don't bother, search the cake in mug recipe on Google that includes egg.

I found this recipe absolutely delicious! I've read many comments saying it's spilled on the sides of the mug but I just stopped the microwave when it rose too much and it was ok. It's very chocolaty by itself but chocolate chips tie it together, in my opinion.
I used gluten-free flour instead in many varieties, including pancake mix, coconut flour, and all-purpose flour. And it was still deliciously perfect!

I followed all the steps exactly and when I put it in the microwave it overflowed and made a huge mess. The cup was microwavable but it still happened. I don't know why it happened but it was probably the recipe.
Full size is very big - 1 recipe makes 2 good size servings. Cook for 35 seconds instead of one minute and forty seconds.

Loved this! I doubled the recipe and added chocolate chips on top after I ‘baked it’. I agree with other commenters - mention you should use a larger bowl. Overall - 5 stars and perfect for a quick chocolate snack !!
It was delicious I loved it
Was craving something sweet, but quick and easy. This was perfect and delicious! Thank you!!
It’s was a great recipe! Though it was a bit dry and little bland. I recommend putting like Nutella or Chocolate Chips to give it some more flavor

This was perfect for my 7 year-old. She wanted to make herself a little cake. We used a cappuccino-style mug and it turned out perfectly, didn't overflow. She put a few chocolate chips and sprinkles on top.

I swapped out the canola oil for olive oil and used baking powder instead of baking soda, and Himalayan salt, also used mint extract instead of vanilla, only gripe is that between the two times I've made those I've found the mug hard to clean after.
Wonderful! Tastes fantastic and even better with ice cream on top.
Uhm…. Didn’t work the way we thought. Still tasted great!

I thought it was good. Mine turned out really dry, (minus 1 star) so I put a few extra splashes of milk. I also put some chocolate chips in there. It was really good when I did that. I do recommend it.
Worked out great for my midnight chocolate craving. Thanks.
It was so good, I had to make more!
Mine started cooking in the microwave and everything cooked over. There was nothing in the mug anymore, everything was on the microwave floor.
don't over fill it just fill it half way so it doesn't explode but real good
Really expected more It did not rise at all like the recipe shows Also cooks very dry even when reducing the time by 20 sec
Taste really good, and is fluffy! However, be careful because it might grow and overload the mug. A lot. Funny though :)
Oh... My... Gosh! This is PERFECT when I'm having a chocolate craving. PLUS: a bit of peanut butter mixed in is nice on occasion. I also like some raisins in it, for variety, OR peanut butter chips!

This was such an amazing recipe I am not able to cook a large cake to eat but this was so much better. Just warning you might want to use a larger cup as it will over flow. It tastes so good and I would definitely recommend it.

Great recipe! I've used it many times and I always love it. This time I doubled the recipe and put it in a small cake tin. It was the perfect size for two people. I baked it at 350 degrees for 25 minutes, but I would recommend doing 375 for 15 minutes. It was light and fluffy and perfect for my late-night chocolate cravings.

I am a very experienced cake/cupcake baker. Alas, I am also diabetic and the two just don't always mesh well. I recently purchased monk fruit sweetener and wanted to see how it worked with a cake. I did not want to bake a full size cake. So I chose this. The only change I made was the monk fruit sugar for regular sugar. I used dutch processed cacao, which is all I had. It was chocolatey, not too sweet, and delicious. I really could not any difference in the sweetness from regular sugar. Also, as a bonus, it was a delicious treat for one person. I will most likely make again, but perhaps switch coffee for the water and part of the milk.
Wouldn't change a thing. Perfect.
On a scale of one to ten, this is a 12.
this was really good I have made this about 20 times now and I still love it as much as the first time I tried it

With my dietary restrictions (no dairy, I used water as suggested) and no gluten (I used my favorite 1-to-1 gf flour), this Chocolate Mug Cake is soooo gooood! And chocolate cake is the one dessert I crave the most and haven't had in over a decade. Thank you!
Really tasty. Used vanilla soya milk and added peanut butter and chocolate chips. Put in microwave for 1 minute 30 seconds, not dry at all. Had with a drizzle of custard 😋

Really good! 👍🏽 I substituted- 1. Coconut oil instead of canola oil as a health preference 2. One egg instead of water to help the cake firm up 3. Cream instead of milk for a more decadent mouth feel I added- 1. 1/4 tsp cinnamon for flavor 2. Chocolate chips over the top after it was cooked, to add some yummy gooeyness! I used a nice big mug, and it came out with a lovely crown. :)
Loved this! Substituted buttermilk add walnuts. Delicious.
Made it according to the directions along with adding milk chocolate chips and a couple caramels. It turned out wonderfully! Great taste and spongy cake like texture.

I made this cake but quantity of milk that describe in recipe is not enough to mix all ingredients together,I had to put more milk to made smooth batter. Otherwise the recipe is fine and the end result is also good. I ended up made a good cake.

The instructions: simple This my first try at baking and OH MY LORD I SCREWED UP it was bubbling weirdly, and when it cooled down it was like a rock but I did use vegetable oil and cooked it longer because of the bubbling AAAAAAAAAAAA
Taste was great, but the texture was off.
Very easy to make. I used a wider mug and switched the canola oil out with vegetable oil and it turned out perfect and delicious. Perfectly moist and chocolatey.

The first time I did this, I used an oversized mug and it still ended up all over my microwave. I tried cooking what remained and it just ended up like burnt chocolate sauce. It was a waste of ingredients and time.

The first time it overflowed the mug and I had to clean up a mess. The second time I made it in a larger bowl and I ended up with chocolate sauce. I didn’t bother to try a 3rd time. What a waste of ingredients and time.
Just love it... I have changed some of the ingredients according to my will and it turn out delicious
I just love it
This recipe is disgusting. Not only is it missing the instruction to use a large mug or bowl, it is also much to salty. I would rate this "recipe" lower, but I cannot.
This tasted so good it felt like I was in heaven!

I made it but the texture was a lot more goopy and not as liquidy as the video (minus 1 star). I added about 3 tablespoons more of liquid (water&milk) and microwaved for 1min 45 seconds and it turned out well. I also put peanut butter in the middle which was good.
The worst mug cake recipe I have found yet it overflowed so much, more of the mug cake was on the microwave tray than in the mug would rate lower but I cannot. Do not recommend.

I was out of baking soda so used baking powder about a 1/4 tsp. I added 1 Tbls of Nutella to the middle of the batter but kept everything else the same. It was perfect! This time I had the baking soda and left out a bit of the sugar. I topped it with some mini chocolate chips and cooked it in my 3 cup purple pyrex bowl. It's my 59th birthday and the other half did not get me a cake. He is not a big fan if chocolate and I am. Worked great for me.
My family loved it :D

I love quick, easy, and delicious mug cakes. And this recipe is just that! Though I did make some slight changes. First, I added a little more sugar than the recipe calls for and it worked out just fine. I didn't have canola oil, but olive oil is a great substitute. One tip is to start with 1:00 minute in the microwave then check on your cake.
I loved it. I chose to make this for breakfast and I made the right choice.
Very good, but i feel like it needs a bit more sweetness
It was an amazing recipe 😋😋
It was great but we didn't have any cocoa so we used hot chocolate but it still worked.

My mug cake was perfect. I had a craving for chocolate cake but no way to get some. It was perfect in a pinch. I used cake flour for this recipe because I didn't have any AP flour on me but still turned out great. Also make sure to use a Jumbo mug though cause it'll rise when cooking and then fall down a bit. I probably would've added a little bit more time for mine because it didn't fully cook at the bottom but that's probably just my microwave.

Love it, I've made it a dozen times now. Made some adjustments over time, cut the cocoa powder down to 1 tablespoon because 2 was too bitter for me, use imitation vanilla because the real stuff is liquid gold, and I mix in a handful of semi sweet chocolate chips before cooking to keep it moist and chocolaty.

I've made this over 10x Now I double it and put it in a microwave safe Tupperware (7 by 3 inches approx- just eyeballing it) and I make a delicious cake some for now and some for later and pop a lid on it for storage!
Really moist and delicious but 1/8 of a teaspoon is hard to get cuz sets come with 1/4 tablespoons 1/2 1 teaspoon and 1 tablespoon
This recipe is so easy and super delicious!!!! It takes no time at all. Highly recommend!
I was good but I let it cook for a min

sooo i didn't really expect this to happen, but while microwaving i realized that the mixture rose to the top and i had to stop it and let it go back down again so i can keep going. i also had to put a plate under it so that it won't spill all over. but it tasted decent XD
It was just so bad, I tried it, followed every move/instruction and it turned into black tar. I put it in for 1min 45sec and it turned out like that.
Loved it , I I totally recommend .it worked on the first try it is so good if you do it right and get a big mug it will work out. Try it out ?
It was really good
Ended up fantastic, did some small swaps however such as about 1/4 less sugar, instead opting to put in some chocolate chip, as well as grapeseed oil in place of canola. Will defiantly do again!

I liked it, I didn’t add the right oil, I added sunflower oil and instead of the right cocoa powder I put dairyfine hot chocolate powder. It came out very nice but quite dry so I added marshmallows. Would recommend
This recipe is amazing! The taste and consistency is incredible. Definitely adding this to my recipe book.

I like this with one addition. I added an egg white the second time I made it. It was a little too dry and crumbly the first time. It was an easy fix to an already tasty little cake. Use a very large mug. I used a handmade latte mug and it was almost full.

Delicious! I misread the instructions (don't get old, folks!) and used 1/4 t salt and baking soda but it still tasted delicious. Imagine what it will taste like when I use the right amount of ingredients. I used almond milk and applesauce. I added chocolate chips. I live by myself so cannot make entire cakes as I will eat the entire cake. This is easy to make, uses only a few dishes and satisfies my sweet tooth. I will most definitely make again. I did use a soup mug instead of a regular mug.

Yummy!! I used a little leftover brewed coffee instead of the water (I used the same amount). Couldn’t really taste the coffee, but the cake still hit the spot! I also noticed the overflow warnings on some other reviews, so I used a mug that holds 2 1/4 cup (18 oz) of liquid and didn’t have any overflow!

We've tried these before and made the same mistake of using a regular-size mug and making a mess. This time I made it and it worked well with good texture and taste. Again I made it with a regular-size mug which was too small. I paused cooking for a few seconds at a time to prevent the cake from spilling over the edges. I set the microwave for 2 minutes but only used about 1:35 of the time. I altered the recipe by adding egg and using the applesauce option. Using the egg variation it didn't come out gooey. for the liquid portion I did the following: • Mixed 1 egg & 2 Tablespoons milk in a ramekin Mixed the following and added to the dry ingredients. ¼ teaspoon vanilla extract 1 1/2 Tablespoons applesauce 3 Tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon egg/milk mix Microwaved on 80% power for about 1 min 35 sec. stopping intermittently for it to settle down to prevent overflow. The cake grew out of the cup about 1 1/2 inches but it didn't overflow. Of course, cook time and power depend on your microwave wattage. Mine is 1100 watts. So at 80%, it is roughly equivalent to 880 watts because it pauses to make 80% of the time, not 80% of the power level.

Super - have tried this twice now. Use a wide mug (16 oz) and it won't overflow. Tried sugar substitute 2nd time - good! Also put a tsp of Kahlua on top after cooking - decadent. This is as yummy as the expensive lava cakes in a fancy restaurant.
Made it many many times before, i reccommend adding chocolate chips and carmel on top!

A little gooey for my taste but still very good. Might’ve been gooey because I’m more a cook than baker (not fond of measurements) but overall very good :) nice treat for late night show binging (specifically hannibal)
Was really good tasting

did everything just as the recipe said. put it in the microwave and i was so excited to eat it just to turn around and see it oozing out of the cup everywhere. i DID use a very large microwave safe cup. i’ve used that same cup for many other mug cakes. this one smelled good but i wasnt able to enjoy it. very disappointed.
I added chocolate chips, leveled it up!
Easy and quick. My 4 year old son made one with me and it was a great bedtime treat!

I loved this so much when I need something so sweet this helped a lot and I'm the only one who loves chocolate in my house so the little mug is so perfect for just me I love it 9/10 totally would want you to make it.
love love love this. best recipe for a mug cake ever tastes like a brownie and take 5 mins for me PS: if you sprinkle powdered sugar on top when your done game changer!
No changes except I had powdered sugar and not granulated. Added the dairy free chocolate chips and coconut milk. Used gluten free flour. It was DELICIOUS!
Yummy 😋
I loved this recipe! was delicious and super easy, the perfect dessert! After microwaving it, I added a little milk and whipped cream to moisten it, and it was delish!
This is THE most BEST mug cake recipe I have ever tried, since I became a chef. Thank you for the recipe.
Ran out of lunch box treats by shopping day. Divided this mix among little chilli jars and sent them in the lunchbox with the lid òn and a teaspoon. Tasty and quick.
Amazing, love this.
Perfect as always. Thanks for a great recipe
Followed the directions. Really dry.
so easy super fun and tasted so good !!
Easy peasy! And very tasty!!
so fluffy and delicious. I added some chocolate chips on top after I took it out and drank milk with it.
i made this cake and it was delicious so fluffy and chocolatie i am in love this will probably be apart of some of my binge watching thanks for the recipe

The perfect consistency and flavor! I used the “healthy version” shown at the bottom which uses apple sauce instead of oil and water instead of milk. I also used Stevia in place of sugar. Glad I made those swaps because I added a dollop of Nutella into the middle of the batter before cooking. It was delicious with a bit of honey and peanut butter drizzled on top!

I really liked this I was gonna make one that was not good and I read the comments and I realized it wouldn't be good so I chose this one and I'm glad I did because it is amazing I added chocolate chips and vanilla ice cream and it was amazing😍
Amazing recipe! Great quick dessert to do when in a rush!

Amazing! Made it in a bowl instead of a mug and added a splash of extra mug (didn’t have any canola oil so used olive) Cooked for one minute 45 seconds in a microwave with a plate covering it and it was lovely. Added powdered sugar and chocolate syrup too! Definitely will make again.
So easy to make and had everything in the pantry or fridge already. Was super moist and tasty! Served w vanilla ice cream and strawberries 😍
It is good I make it alot thank you for making this recipe :)

This recipe is great! I doubled mine and put it in a medium sized bowl. I also made a Peanut Butter Cream cheese topping. 1/2 a container (4-6oz) of Whipped cream cheese 1/4 cup Peanut butter 2 table spoons of sugar 3 table spoons honey (Also once the cake is about 3/4’s of the way done, if you want, you can stuff the PB mixture in the center and microwave for the remainder of the time it has to cook or an extra 45-60 seconds, it is DELICIOUS this way! It was so good) pop your cake in the freezer to cool and your topping in the fridge for about 5 minutes and then add your PB topping and a little chocolate drizzle on top and the. serve or eat to yourself! DELICIOUS!
